name: Kheer
short_description: Kheer or payasam is an ancient Indian dessert, a creamy rice pudding that is made in several versions across the country. It is a common dish at numerous Indian ceremonies, festivals, and celebrations...

name: Rasgulla
short_description: Rasgulla is a traditional sweet that is usually served at the end of a meal, like many other Indian milk-based desserts. It is prepared from chhena paneer dumplings and semolina dough, cooked together...

name: Khaja
short_description: Khaja is a traditional dessert consisting of flour, sugar, and ghee-based dough that is deep-fried in oil until golden and crispy. After the preparation, khaja is sometimes soaked in sugar syrup, depe...

name: Pitha
short_description: Pitha is a large group of bread and cakes that are popular throughout Bangladesh and India. The most common base for pitha is rice flour, although wheat or corn flour can also be used. Most varieties ...

name: Pakhala
short_description: Pakhala or water rice is a humble Indian dish that combines cooked rice with water and a variety of spices. There are numerous variations on the dish, including dahi pakhala (pakhala with curd), basi ...

name: Santula
short_description: Santula is a traditional mixed vegetable dish originating from Odisha. The dish is usually made with a combination of any available fresh and seasonal vegetables such as eggplants, tomatoes, beans, ca...

name: Baked cheese (Chhena poda)
short_description: Chhena poda is a traditional cheese dessert originating from Odisha. It's usually made with a combination of chhena cheese, sugar, rice flour, cardamom, and optional ingredients such as raisins, almon...

name: Kundal

name: Arisa pitha
